title: Hextech Chests.
body: Honestly, I feel a little ripped off, so many times have I opened a chest only to get a champion, now sure, this would be a great thing.... If I didn't own every champion league has to offer.. Alas my earnt IP gets the better of me, just too many hours played I guess, but surely it wouldn't be unfair for the chests to only unlock skins if the player already has every champion. Just food for thought.

replies.body:
Hextech chests aren't meant to completely replace the shop (which is something that would likely happen if what you are suggesting was implemented for those players). As it stands, it seems like these is a slightly more chance of getting a skin than a champion. 

Even if you already own all the champions, you can just hoard the shards to re-roll them upon the release of new champions.
What would the point be of re-rolling for the new champ, when the time comes that a new champ has been released I've got so much IP saved I can buy the champ straight away, regardless? :P

Save the IP for trolling your friends by changing your name every week :P

Soon enough your champ shards will be useful as you can use them for the higher up champion mastery levels.

That comment humours me, considering in the past month I've been known as SoCloseToStoned, ConcreteJunkie and now, not 5 minutes before reading this, I've yet again changed to JohnCenaConfirmd.

I guess I will save the shards instead of wasting them re-rolling. xD

There's a 50% chance to get a skin, same as with a champion.

I believe the chest first says "Skin or Champion?"

Then it metaphorically chooses from the box of skins/champions.

Technically, it's all completely random. No set rates. 
For me and the majority of my friends, it seems that we get more skins than champs (just started tracking this).

[Even then, you are going to be needing your champ shards to unlock mastery ranks 6&7.](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/uAFzxTpO-testing-champ-mastery-levels-6-and-7)
